comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: The picture shows the Martin TT Biplane, which can (easily) be identified by the extra two front wheels mounted on the skids ("anti-noseover") and the ailerons mounted between the wings. Late production machines were fitted with ailerons on the wings and also different engines were fitted. Relatively few machines (ca. 10) were built before 1914 for the Aeronautical Division of the United States Army Signal Corps.
